alert.note: Alert for La Salle (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 11 at 10:31AM CDT until May 11 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN LA SALLE PARISH... At 1030 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Jena, or 24 miles south of Columbia, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern La Salle Parish. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
